## GerstnerWaveGenerator.getOriginX() method

Gets the X coordinate of the wave origin if it is an omni-directional wave.

**Signature:**

```typescript
getOriginX(waveIndex: number): number;
```

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

waveIndex


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

index of the wave to set.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

number

X coordinate of the wave origin if it is an omni-directional wave, 0 otherwise.
